revised_title: The Influence of Hydrogen on the Pyrolysis of Ethane and Ethylene
tldr: This article investigates the influence of hydrogen on the pyrolysis of ethane and ethylene near 600°C. The authors found that hydrogen indirectly affects the rates of other reactions taking place, and they developed a method to analyze the complex gas mixtures produced during the experiments. The results showed that the rate of formation of condensate and the rate of disappearance of ethane were influenced by the presence of hydrogen.
